<h2 title="Class DBCollection" class="title">Class DBCollection</h2>
</div>
<div class="contentContainer">
<ul class="inheritance">
<li><a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">java.lang.Object</a></li>
<li>
<ul class="inheritance">
<li>com.mongodb.DBCollection</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="description">
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<hr>
<br>
<pre><a href="../../com/mongodb/annotations/ThreadSafe.html" title="annotation in com.mongodb.annotations">@ThreadSafe</a>
public class <span class="typeNameLabel">DBCollection</span>
extends <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">Object</a></pre>
<div class="block">Implementation of a database collection. A typical invocation sequence is thus:
<pre>
<code>
MongoClient mongoClient = new MongoClient(new ServerAddress("localhost", 27017));
DB db = mongoClient.getDB("mydb");
DBCollection collection = db.getCollection("test"); </code>
</pre>
To get a collection to use, just specify the name of the collection to the getCollection(String collectionName) method:
<pre>
<code>
DBCollection coll = db.getCollection("testCollection"); </code>
</pre>
Once you have the collection object, you can insert documents into the collection:
<pre>
<code>
BasicDBObject doc = new BasicDBObject("name", "MongoDB").append("type", "database")
.append("count", 1)
.append("info", new BasicDBObject("x", 203).append("y", 102));
coll.insert(doc); </code>
</pre>
To show that the document we inserted in the previous step is there, we can do a simple findOne() operation to get the first document in
the collection:
<pre>
<code>
DBObject myDoc = coll.findOne();
System.out.println(myDoc); </code>
</pre>

See <a href="../../com/mongodb/Mongo.html#getDB-java.lang.String-"><code>Mongo.getDB(String)</code></a> for further information about the effective deprecation of this class.</div>
<dl><dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/glossary/#term-collection'>Collection</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="summary">
<ul class="blockList">

<h4>insert</h4>
<pre>public&nbsp;<a href="../../com/mongodb/WriteResult.html" title="class in com.mongodb">WriteResult</a>&nbsp;insert&#8203;(<a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/List.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.util">List</a>&lt;? extends <a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&gt;&nbsp;documents,
<a href="../../com/mongodb/InsertOptions.html" title="class in com.mongodb">InsertOptions</a>&nbsp;insertOptions)</pre>
<div class="block"><p>Insert documents into a collection. If the collection does not exists on the server, then it will be created. If the new document
does not contain an '_id' field, it will be added.</p>

<p>If the value of the continueOnError property of the given <code>InsertOptions</code> is true,
that value will override the value of the continueOnError property of the given <code>WriteConcern</code>. Otherwise,
the value of the continueOnError property of the given <code>WriteConcern</code> will take effect. </p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>documents</code> - a list of <code>DBObject</code>'s to be inserted</dd>
<dd><code>insertOptions</code> - the options to use for the insert</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the result of the operation</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/DuplicateKeyException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">DuplicateKeyException</a></code> - if the write failed to a duplicate unique key</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/WriteConcernException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">WriteConcernException</a></code> - if the write failed due some other failure specific to the insert command</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/MongoException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">MongoException</a></code> - if the operation failed for some other reason</dd>

<a id="save-com.mongodb.DBObject-">
<!-- -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>save</h4>
<pre>public&nbsp;<a href="../../com/mongodb/WriteResult.html" title="class in com.mongodb">WriteResult</a>&nbsp;save&#8203;(<a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&nbsp;document)</pre>
<div class="block">Update an existing document or insert a document depending on the parameter. If the document does not contain an '_id' field, then
the method performs an insert with the specified fields in the document as well as an '_id' field with a unique objectId value. If
the document contains an '_id' field, then the method performs an upsert querying the collection on the '_id' field:
<ul>
<li>If a document does not exist with the specified '_id' value, the method performs an insert with the specified fields in
the document.</li>
<li>If a document exists with the specified '_id' value, the method performs an update,
replacing all field in the existing record with the fields from the document.</li>
</ul></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>document</code> - <a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb"><code>DBObject</code></a> to save to the collection.</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the result of the operation</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/DuplicateKeyException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">DuplicateKeyException</a></code> - if the write failed to a duplicate unique key</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/WriteConcernException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">WriteConcernException</a></code> - if the write failed due some other failure specific to the insert or update command</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../../com/mongodb/MongoException.html" title="class in com.mongodb">MongoException</a></code> - if the operation failed for some other reason</dd>
<dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/tutorial/modify-documents/#modify-a-document-with-save-method'>Save</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>

<li class="blockList">
<h4>group</h4>
<pre><a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/lang/Deprecated.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">@Deprecated</a>
public&nbsp;<a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&nbsp;group&#8203;(<a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&nbsp;key,
<a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&nbsp;cond,
<a href="../../com/mongodb/DBObject.html" title="interface in com.mongodb">DBObject</a>&nbsp;initial,
<a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/lang/String.html?is-external=true" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</a>&nbsp;reduce)</pre>
<div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span>&nbsp;<span class="deprecationComment">The group command was deprecated in MongoDB 3.4</span></div>
<div class="block">Group documents in a collection by the specified key and performs simple aggregation functions such as computing counts and sums.
This is analogous to a <code>SELECT ... GROUP BY</code> statement in SQL.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>key</code> - specifies one or more document fields to group</dd>
<dd><code>cond</code> - specifies the selection criteria to determine which documents in the collection to process</dd>
<dd><code>initial</code> - initializes the aggregation result document</dd>
<dd><code>reduce</code> - specifies an $reduce function, that operates on the documents during the grouping operation</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>a document with the grouped records as well as the command meta-data</dd>
<dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/command/group/'>Group Command</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="block"><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span>&nbsp;<span class="deprecationComment">The group command was deprecated in MongoDB 3.4</span></div>
<div class="block">Group documents in a collection by the specified key and performs simple aggregation functions such as computing counts and sums.
This is analogous to a <code>SELECT ... GROUP BY</code> statement in SQL.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>key</code> - specifies one or more document fields to group</dd>
<dd><code>cond</code> - specifies the selection criteria to determine which documents in the collection to process</dd>
<dd><code>initial</code> - initializes the aggregation result document</dd>
<dd><code>reduce</code> - specifies an $reduce Javascript function, that operates on the documents during the grouping operation</dd>
<dd><code>finalize</code> - specifies a Javascript function that runs each item in the result set before final value will be returned</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>a document with the grouped records as well as the command meta-data</dd>
<dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/command/group/'>Group Command</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>

<dd><code>remove</code> - when <code>true</code>, removes the selected document</dd>
<dd><code>returnNew</code> - when true, returns the modified document rather than the original</dd>
<dd><code>update</code> - the modifications to apply</dd>

after the changes were made</dd>

<a id="initializeOrderedBulkOperation--">
<!-- -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>initializeOrderedBulkOperation</h4>
<pre>public&nbsp;<a href="../../com/mongodb/BulkWriteOperation.html" title="class in com.mongodb">BulkWriteOperation</a>&nbsp;initializeOrderedBulkOperation&#8203;()</pre>
<div class="block"><p>Creates a builder for an ordered bulk write operation, consisting of an ordered collection of write requests, which can be any
combination of inserts, updates, replaces, or removes. Write requests included in the bulk operations will be executed in order, and
will halt on the first failure.</p>

<p>Note: While this bulk write operation will execute on MongoDB 2.4 servers and below, the writes will be performed one at a time,
as that is the only way to preserve the semantics of the value returned from execution or the exception thrown.</p>

<p>Note: While a bulk write operation with a mix of inserts, updates, replaces, and removes is supported, the implementation will
batch up consecutive requests of the same type and send them to the server one at a time. For example, if a bulk write operation
consists of 10 inserts followed by 5 updates, followed by 10 more inserts, it will result in three round trips to the server.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the builder</dd>
<dt><span class="simpleTagLabel">Since:</span></dt>
<dd>2.12</dd>
<dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/method/db.collection.initializeOrderedBulkOp/'>initializeOrderedBulkOp()</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="initializeUnorderedBulkOperation--">
<!-- -->
</a>
<ul class="blockListLast">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>initializeUnorderedBulkOperation</h4>
<pre>public&nbsp;<a href="../../com/mongodb/BulkWriteOperation.html" title="class in com.mongodb">BulkWriteOperation</a>&nbsp;initializeUnorderedBulkOperation&#8203;()</pre>
<div class="block"><p>Creates a builder for an unordered bulk operation, consisting of an unordered collection of write requests, which can be any
combination of inserts, updates, replaces, or removes. Write requests included in the bulk operation will be executed in an undefined
order, and all requests will be executed even if some fail.</p>

<p>Note: While this bulk write operation will execute on MongoDB 2.4 servers and below, the writes will be performed one at a time,
as that is the only way to preserve the semantics of the value returned from execution or the exception thrown.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the builder</dd>
<dt><span class="simpleTagLabel">Since:</span></dt>
<dd>2.12</dd>
<dl><dt><span class="strong">MongoDB documentation</span></dt><dd><a href='http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/method/db.collection.initializeUnorderedBulkOp/'>initializeUnorderedBulkOp()</a></dd></dl>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</section>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
